results:
Based on the search results, I found information about Jakub Ekier's 2016 Polish translation of Franz Kafka's "The Trial" (Proces) published by Officyna:

Jakub Ekier undertook the effort of a new reading of Franz Kafka's masterpiece. The reissue of "The Trial" in his translation has just been published by the Łódź-based publisher Officyna.(no content)On September 19, a reissue of Franz Kafka's "The Trial" translated by Jakub Ekier will be published.(no content)Franz Kafka, The Trial, Translation: Jakub Ekier, Premiere: September 19, 2016, Publisher Officyna

The new translation has several important features:

The fresh translation of "The Trial" avoids philological mistakes of the earlier one and includes chapters discarded by Kafka.(no content)It also tries to recreate the symbolic character of this surreal prose, as well as its factual language, irony and humor.(no content)The first Polish translation of "The Trial" was made when reflection on Kafka did not exist.(no content)In Poland, Kafka was translated starting from the 1930s of the last century, including "The Trial" twice - the first translation was made in 1936 by Józefina Szelińska, and it was reviewed and signed by Bruno Schulz.

The book includes additional materials: In this edition, useful essays were added by the translator, as well as Prof. Łukasz Musiał, who received the prestigious "Literatura na Świecie" award for his book "Kafka. In Search of Lost Reality".

According to the search results, while one source mentions a publication date of 2016-01-01, the book was actually released or reissued on September 19, 2016.
